intro: Cyrtandra × subcordata, commonly known as the hybrid Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant belonging to the Gesneriaceae family. It is a hybrid species resulting from the cross between Cyrtandra cordata and Cyrtandra subcordata, exhibiting traits from both parent species. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It is native to tropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by horticultural enthusiasts.
